description.narrative:
UNFPA har utarbetat ett projektförslag som bidrar till deras landprogram. Projektet har som mål att bidra till att grundläggande förutsättningar skapas för att befolkningen ska kunna utkräva sina sexuella och reproduktiva rättigheter och rätten till ett liv utan våld. Projektet ska genomföras på nationell-, distrikts- och kommunal nivå under perioden 2021 - 2023 och har en budget på 30 MSEK. Det är planerat att genomföras i 14 kommuner i fyra distrikt, nämligen: Chuquisaca, Potosí, Cochabamba and Pando. Insatsen definierar fyra resultat:
- Offentliga policys avseende SRHR och frihet från könsbaserat våld implementeras. - Förbättrad service av hög kvalitet gällande SRHR och könsbaserat våld samt stärkt sexualundervisning implementeras. - Kvinnogrupper, ursprungsfolksgrupper och andra civilsamhällsorganisationer utövar social kontroll gällande SRHR. - Befolkningen utkräver skydd av sina sexuella och reproduktiva rättigheter och hälsa.
Detta ska åstadkommas genom policydialog, påverkansarbete, framtagande av kunskap, kompetenshöjning och stärkande av institutioner. UNFPA kommer att samarbeta med relevanta ministerier och andra institutioner på nationell nivå samt relevanta myndigheter på distrikts- och kommunal nivå. Civilsamhällets organisationer kommer också att vara en samarbetspart.

UNFPA has prepared a project proposal that contributes to their country program. The project aims to contribute to the creation of basic conditions for the population to be able to claim their sexual and reproductive rights and the right to a life without violence. The project will be implemented at national, district and municipal level during the period 2021 - 2023 and has a budget of SEK 30 million. It is planned to be implemented in 14 municipalities in four districts, namely: Chuquisaca, Potosí, Cochabamba and Pando. The effort defines four results:
- Public policies regarding SRHR and freedom from gender-based violence are implemented. - Improved high-quality service regarding SRHR and gender-based violence as well as strengthened sex education are implemented. - Women's groups, indigenous peoples' groups and other civil society organizations exercise social control over SRHR. - The population demands protection of their sexual and reproductive rights and health.
This is to be achieved through policy dialogue, advocacy work, development of knowledge, skills development and strengthening of institutions. UNFPA will cooperate with relevant ministries and other institutions at national level as well as relevant authorities at district and municipal level. Civil society organizations will also be a partner.

UNFPA has prepared a project proposal that contributes to their country program (2018-2022). A transition bridge support to the UNFPA Bolivia Country Programme 2021-2022: "Ensuring Sexual and Reproductive Rights in Bolivia by leaving no one behind".
The project is to contribute to the Plurinational State of Bolivia's efforts to reduce geographical, socio-economic, gender, cultural, and generational inequalities in sexual and reproductive rights, specifically in the areas of reduction of maternal mortality, adolescent pregnancies, sexual violence and other harmful practices. The initiative specifically focuses on including and promoting participation of sexually diverse population groups and other population in vulnerable situations, especially in women, girls, adolescents, and youth living in rural and peri-urban areas, indigenous peoples, Afro-Bolivians, and persons with disabilities.

The expected results are:
1. Strengthened national capacities to ensure universal access to high-quality integrated sexual and reproductive health information and services for women, indigenous peoples, male and female Afro-Bolivians, adolescents and youth, sexually diverse people, persons with disabilities from rural and peri-urban areas, including those in a humanitarian settings and public health emergencies.
2. Strengthened national capacities to prevent and respond to child marriages, forced child or adolescent pregnancies and childbearing, and gender-based violence. Thus, this outcome will ensure the comprehensive development and sexual and reproductive rights of girls and their social participation and empowerment
3. Strengthened national capacities for all people in Bolivia to exercise their sexual and reproductive rights and their right to live a life free of gender-based violence, strengthened gender equality between men and women, including sexual diversities, by empowering women, strengthening their organizations and by strengthening the coordination of responsible instances in prevention, response and sanction of violence, in particular sexual violence.
4. Strengthened national capacities for generation, analysis, use, and dissemination of quality-disaggregated data, focusing on identifying gaps and inequalities to guide public policies and evidence-based advocacy actions.
5. Communications as the crosscutting strategy, to support the populations exercise of health and sexual and reproductive rights practice, especially women and girls and other target populations.
UNFPA will cooperate with relevant ministries and other institutions at national level as well as relevant authorities at district and municipal level. Civil society organizations are coming also to be a partner. The project has as a goal to contribute to the creation of basic conditions for the population to be able to claim their sexual and reproductive rights and the right to a life without violence.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
